Detailed Description

Used for communication over the CAN bus.

Allows to send frames and will spawn a reader thread that executes a loop that continuously checks for new frames on the CAN bus and keeps the last frame of any CAN object ID stored in a buffer to be queried at a later time.

cpr_robot::Bus::Bus ( const std::string &  interfaceName = "can0")

Connects the CAN bus and starts a thread that will asynchronuously spin in a read loop.

Parameters
interfaceNameThe interface name of the CAN bus. Defaults to "can0".

◆ ~Bus()

cpr_robot::Bus::~Bus ( )
virtual

Will cause the read loop in case it is spinning.

In that case the reader thread will be terminated and joined.

Definition at line 234 of file Bus.cpp.

◆ get_LastFrame()

struct can_frame cpr_robot::Bus::get_LastFrame ( const canid_t  id,
std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::time_point &  receptionTime,
bool &  bValid 
)

Returns the last frame of a specific CAN object ID that was received from the bus.

Parameters
idThe CAN object ID of the requested frame.
receptionTimeWill be set to the timepoint at which the frame was received from the bus.
bValidWill be true if a valid frame of the requested CAN object ID has been received. If false no frame of that CAN object ID has been received yet.
Returns
The last frame of the requested CAN object ID that was received from the bus.

Definition at line 50 of file Bus.cpp.

◆ get_ReadTimeout()

double cpr_robot::Bus::get_ReadTimeout ( ) const

Provides information about the timeout for read operations on the CAN bus.

Currently the value is hardcoded to 50ms. If no message is received within that time the underlying socket will generate a timeout error, allowing the thread to yield CPU time to other processes or threads.

Returns
The timeout delay in seconds.

Definition at line 19 of file Bus.cpp.

◆ OnStart()

void cpr_robot::Bus::OnStart ( )
private

Starts the read loop.

A reader thread will be spawned that will poll the CAN bus asynchronuously.

Definition at line 94 of file Bus.cpp.

◆ OnStop()

void cpr_robot::Bus::OnStop ( )
private

Signals the read loop to stop spinning.

This method will wait until the reader thread terminates and joins.

Definition at line 130 of file Bus.cpp.

◆ ReadLoop()

void cpr_robot::Bus::ReadLoop ( )
private

The read loop. Will keep spinning until a stop is requested by calling the Stop method or destructor.

void cpr_robot::Bus::ReadThread ( Bus *  pBus)
staticprivate

The entry point for the reader thread.

Parameters
pBusPointer to the Bus instance that the thread will be associated to.

Definition at line 8 of file Bus.cpp.

◆ Start()

void cpr_robot::Bus::Start ( )

Requests the read loop to be started.

This is a public thread-safe wrapper for the private OnStart method. A reader thread will be spawned that will poll the CAN bus asynchronuously.

Definition at line 85 of file Bus.cpp.

◆ Stop()

void cpr_robot::Bus::Stop ( )

Requests to stop the read loop.

This is a public thread-safe wrapper for the private OnStop method. The reader thread will be terminated and joined.

Definition at line 149 of file Bus.cpp.

Parameters
